Reviews.Title: “Pushing it to call this 4 star”
Reviews.Author: mrmoorthe
Reviews.Content: We were put in a car park facing room which was 50% obstructed by another room. So the view litrarly was car park and the hotel itself. For 250 USD a night ( the taxes jacks it up considerabally from prices displayed) youd hope for better...requested another room since wasnt keen on looking at that for 3 nights, nice enough for the hotel to change to a city facing view, still wasnt anything to write home about or indeed, look at at night.... Fixtures in the whole needs updating, the hair dryer's tube was taped on since this has come off rendering the hair dryer pretty much useless since half the heat leaked out from said gap ( 5 stars you say?) Room was a nice bed with a couch, you can expect this from any 4 stars I reckon. Staff are polite enough. Entrance seemed very 80s. Best thing? Probably the buffet breakfast. Location-wise all other hotels on the main road would be fine since youd be taxi-ing all the time anyway ( pretty cheap starting meters) Still, for this sort of money, I would recommend hitting up the newer hotels, Dusit Thani, Rotana ( if thats the right spelling) I had the choice of the 3 and although I did not stay in the other 2 Im pretty sure the age of the other 2 propperty probably means at least the fixtures, the finishing, lobby, feel would be better Theres nothing the GM can do to remedy the points Ive made above since unless the hotel is going to do a refurbishment anytime soon its going to be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: samsam3018
Reviews.Content: One of the good hotel that I've ever stayed, convenient location, helpful staff, value for money, try it you wont regret!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: eimermcgeown
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were lucky enough to stay in this hotel where we had a great holiday. Friendly atmosphere and caring staff. Our holiday had started badly with a flight delay from dublin to london where our luggage was left behind. We had gone to dubai to celebrate my birthday with the highlight being an evening at the dubai horse racing on the saturday of our arrival. As our luggage did not arrive we had no clothes to wear so missed out in going to the races which was very, very, very disappointing. On telling our story to the Director of sales and Marketing, Michaela Smith she immediately offered us a complimentary extra night which meant we could go to the races on the following saturday if we could change our flights. We were delighted with this offer as virgin atlantic had stated they would change our flights from the saturday to the sunday. However on ringing them they informed us that the flight on the sunday was fully booked so we had to return on the saturday and miss the races. We our however very grateful to the crown plaza staff for their kind offer and help and hope to return to stay with them again in the future and eventually get to the horse racing at Maydan race course. We felt we were given a very personal service by all the staff at this hotel from the General Manager Georges down. Having sure good Managers/leadership at this hotel ensures clients receive a first class service. Thank you one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel well connected”
Reviews.Author: vigri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located on the main road, between 2 metro stations. there are supermarkets and cafe places around. Rooms are small and you cannot open the windows, so is pretty funny if you stay in a smoking room. the cleaning service comes very early, so you have to put a "do not disturb" message to do not get somebody at the door at 8am, even in the week end. Breackfast is fairly good with good choices of different foods. The pub and wine place in the hotel are pretty nice, maybe the coffee is too expensive. the italian restaurant is ok, but rush hours/working day, it is understaffed

Reviews.Title: “Review Crowne Plaza Sheikh Zayed Road”
Reviews.Author: ChristianFlicenFlac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days, very pleasant hotel, 7 good restaurants, staff very helpful. Very well located.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and happening location:)”
Reviews.Author: fauziafarhan
Reviews.Content: First of all our experience was really good as the hotel was on the most happening place of dubai that is shaikh zayyed rd.The metro station was near by less than 5 mins walk from where u can go to various malls including dubail mall,ibnebatuta,mall of emirates etc.The hotel is not at all 5 star as it is shown in different sites but it was a very nice and comfortable hotel.The staff was very friendly and helpful.There are labnese restaurants near by which offer excellent food.Mc donalds,burger king ,subway are all near if u want to enjoy fastfood.Some superstore are also in close vicinity if u want to buy any groceryu as i did because i had a small kitchen in our hotel appartment.I would highly recommend this hotel to evryone but dont expect it too be too lavish or 5 star.But just perfect to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good wholesome pub grub”
Reviews.Author: LAWRIET
Reviews.Content: Although not staying at the CP this time, it was good to visit the Harvester Pub there for some straight forward pub grub.Dubai is wonderful for exotic foods of all kinds, but this is the place to go to eat because you are hungry. Good old fish and chips or sausage and mash at reasonable prices. For some, it may be a bit noisy for 'old' ears, but there's loads of sports on the myriad of surrounding TVs, and the option to smoke if you want to (its well ventilated & not a problem). Just like the pub back home used to be.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the best value”
Reviews.Author: FullThrottle64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for several days as part of a recent trade show. While overall it was a decent hotel, I would suggest that it's not as good as the many published rankings would have one believe. Some items I took issue with: 1) I paid for a "club" room, but was put into an "apartment" on the same floor as the "club rooms" - but in the second tower. This was NOT a good deal; the room was not equivalent. 2) I had to ride one elevator down to the lobby and back up in another every time I met others in my group, went to breakfast, etc. This was due to #1, above. 3) I never received the daily newspaper delivery I paid for as part of #1. 4) The wireless internet service was spotty at best; I had to ask multiple times for login/password pairs that would work, and was never able to get more than one device to work at a time (even with multiple logon IDs). Speeds were quite slow for this level of hotel. 5) No minibar in the room, and no convenience shop in the hotel - no way to get even a basic soft drink without dressing to go into a restaurant or bar, or going down the street to an outside shop. 6) Pricing was excessive, even for Dubai. This was especially true in the hotel restaurants - $75US for a bottle of wine that sells for $8 retail isn't reasonable anywhere. 7) A coffee-maker in the room would have been nice, given the price point. Given all of these issues, I will give them credit for having generally good service, including a same-day laundry. The facility also had a wide variety of restaurant options; while over-priced, they were better than one would get at a comparable property in the US. Live music in several of them was a nice touch, as well. Although I didn't get the level of room I paid for, I will say that it was comfortable, had a great view, the bed was about right, etc. Although there was no airport transfer bus here, there's really no need for one, as the Metro and/or taxis are easy and convenient. Bottom line: It's expensive, but I might stay here again when I return, anyway - the negatives weren't bad enough to ruin my trip, and next time I'll know how to avoid them.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbymakam
Reviews.Content: Great staff who do go that bit further to make sure you are well looked after, excellent food, efficient service, comfortable rooms with A1 facilities. You do not need anything else !

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: GKCA
Reviews.Content: Worth for business trips. Nice locality and good restaurants, shopping etc. Rooms are fairly well lit. Maintenance could have been better as the shower in the bathroom was showering the whole room due to leakage! Wireless connectivity was poor. Room service was good but you need to chase them for everything more than twice.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Ameglio
Reviews.Content: Good location on the Sheik Zayed Road, but this is a little strage with Reception being on the 1st floor up an escalator. Rooms are comfortable and OK if a little dated. Gym was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: TommyKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back,wasn't impressed by the hotel at all. Rooms were old a tatty, the bar area pretty plain. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Dubai standard”
Reviews.Author: evaogriseg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for several weeks as it offers some good business rates. The rooms are very spacious, however, a refurbishment would not hurt as it is very 80s style. The lounge for Club-guests on the 17th floor is very nice and comfortable, especially for the evening happy hour, where they also serve little snacks and drinks (alcoholic/non-alcoholic) for no extra charge. Club-guests can also enjoy breakfast there. The breakfast room for the "regular" guests is unfortunately not as enjoyable. Many tables and dishes are stained and don't look very new anymore. There is a wide choice of food available. Staff is generally very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dilipparikh
Reviews.Content: Room was big for 3 persons. Guest relationship staff was excellent. Intercom didn't get fixed for calling in room dining service. House keeping was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Typical Business hotel with a strategic location”
Reviews.Author: SH082
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a history and it's a landmark in Dubai, it's location is very attractive, located on Sheikh Zayed road in the middle of the city, easy access to all other areas. It is a typical business hotel that provides all facilities for a business traveller. Usually a very busy hotel in terms of meetings and very entertaining in terms of out-lets and bars. It is an old property comparing to the new modern hotels opening around the city, the furniture in the rooms are very old in style, colorus and quality as well as the reception on an upper level with no proper lobby which makes it look poor and not very attractive to the guests. The quality of food at the buffet breakfast can be better, and should have a larger space comparing to the hotel itself. Reception and bell boys are of a great help, and i definitely recommend Crowne Plaza Sheikh Zayed.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: multimedia0312
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for few nights after landing Thursday night before moving on in Dubai. Hotel clean and staff friendly. It's not Mina A' Salam standard but there again about half the price.

Reviews.Title: “A fair property, nothing particularly wrong but not special either”
Reviews.Author: adityamittalsae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of December 2011 as a part of a tour with my wife and 3 other relatives. First the good things: Great location! As they say, location is very important for a hotel. You won't feel bored with all the restaurants lined along the street. Check in and check out is really quick which gives an impression that this has been trained to be a business hotel. The buffet breakfast is quite nice, specially for an Indian like me there is a lot of decent Indian stuff. Now, the not so good stuff: nothing really other than the fact that the property has become dated. They tell me this is one of the oldest hotels in Dubai, and I think it looks the age! The room that was given to me wasnt great, inspite of booking well over one month in advance and having requested for a room with a view. To be fair, two of our 3 rooms were given upgrades and probably due to the heavy tourist season, I was the casualty! All in all, an efficiently run, small business hotel. 5 star...can't say! Don't go expecting a lot, and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “hotel on the motorway”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: area is too noisy with roaring traffic that seems non-stop on Sheik Zayeed Road think this hotel (like many others in Dubai) is more popular for their night club than their lodging many hotel options in Dubai these days, no reason to stay here unless you have business nearby

Reviews.Title: “A Landmark that should take better of itself ..”
Reviews.Author: Maherthebest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Crowne Plaza Dubai - Sheikh Zayed road 3 times in 2009-2010-2011 .. the 3 times were business trips, I believe this hotel is a famous landmark in Sheikh Zayed road and in the middle of Dubai financial center, this hotel is always busy, like a Bee nest, a lot of people stay at this hotel for business, companies, meetings and even overnight staying flights cabin crews. The hotel is growing old, yes it is more practical than being luxury but a famous hotel like crowne plaza- Shiekh Zayed road must be treated better well, the furniture is going a bit old and need to be replaced, the same story regarding the carpets, bathrooms and even the swimming pool and the surrounding area and so on ... anyway, I evaluate my staying there for a business need as good-very good and I recommend that hotel .. Note : in the 3 times I stayed in the reservation was done by my company not by me, but even though, I would have probably selected Crowne plaza- Sheikh Zayed Road

Reviews.Title: “One of the many average options”
Reviews.Author: LoraTraveling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located - close to the World Trade Center and you can even walk (if the weather permits). Room service is OK.. Service also OK.. nothing special. I've got upgraded and the room facing the main road which I'm not sure was an upgrade although the view was supposed to be nicer. Biz center is helpful as well as the overall staff.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in a pleasant hotel in a great location :)”
Reviews.Author: tigorbear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night to celebrate our anniversary. We chose it because we got a special rate using my husbands Privledge Card. We had read some of the reviews from Tripadvisor but decided to try it out for ourselves =) It was generally a pleasant stay and we did enjoy our time there. There were only some minor annoyances but nothing big enough that we wouldnt come back again :) Will list some of the pros and cons below: *PROS: - Room was large and clean. It was big enough to have a sofa and coffee table (not just standard arm chairs) - Bathroom was large and clean too. Had comfy robes and towels. Plenty of hoter water. - King size bed and pillows were comfortable. - You can manually turn the air con on or off. - Room had a trouser press which I'd never seen before. - Friendly reception staff and bellboys. - Clean hotel entrance, not overly fancy decor but still pleasant. - Sakura Japanese restaurant!!! Would totally recommend it! Fresh dishes bursting with flavour. Especially their prawn tempura sushi, was so delicious Im drooling on my keyboard now just thinking about it. :) - Complimentary dates and arabic coffee in the foyer Friday morning :) - Concierge was very helpful with directions and info :) - Hotel is in a FANTASTIC location - next to lots of restaurants and cafes (walking distance) and a short drive to some major tourist places like Dubai Mall etc *CONS (not major, but just small annoyances): - Valet parking could use more organising. It took us awhile to be able to pull in because of all the cars lined up, some of them just parked on the side waiting to be moved. They probably could use with more people working out the front. - There should be NO smoking allowed outside the hotel entrance - looks incrediably tacky when you have people hanging around outside having a drag!!! Not to mention Im 6 months pregnant, and having to walk thru a cloud of smoke to get into the hotel or into my car was terrible. - We had to wait 40 minutes before our room was ready - even though we checked in around 4.30pm. Wasnt overly impressed about this. - Instructions for the safe were hard to follow or wouldnt work properly so we couldnt use it. - When we checked out, reception told us that two cans of soda were missing from the fridge - even though we didnt even OPEN the fridge once during the whole stay. Although they believed us, it was a bit annoying to have to be questioned at all. Some hotels have the option where you can request in advance for the room mini bar to be locked so that you can check out more easily. They should have done this for us. But overall, it wasnt a bad stay. The price we paid for the stay was so-so but it was overall pleasant :)

Reviews.Title: “Very average - better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Snitchbolt
Reviews.Content: The only real thing going for this place is location. It is one of the oldest hotels in Dubai located centrally opposite the convention centre and the Emirates Towers and nearby to a metro station. However, the hotel is very tired and does not otherwise have much going for it. I have stayed in about 15 different hotels in Dubai over the last 5 years and this is one of my least preferred. It is right near our office hence why I stayed here on this occasion but there are much better options available for a lot less money. I prefer to stay near the Mall of the Emirates in Al Barsha (also has a metro station), at the Convention Centre itself (e.g. the Novotel) or the Burjaman Rotana or somewhere closer to the Creek. The service at this hotel is okay but if you are a Priority Club member stay somewhere else like the Holiday Inn Al Barsha. There is a Wagamama downstairs and a few other restaurants in the hotel but the shops in the arcade adjoining the hotel have now mostly all closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business”
Reviews.Author: romeu40
Reviews.Content: superior reception from airport to hotel and very smooth check out. Friendly and professional staff. Excellent for business. Dedicated breakfast room for buisness guests

Reviews.Title: “Even I like but it needs improvments”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Advisor
Reviews.Content: I am frequent guest at the Crowne plaza. I will try to make my review as truthful/frank as possible. I did talk to the hotel management about my comments and they promised they are working to improve. The location of the hotel is Brilliant/ the hotel staff are amazing/helpful. No activities for children inside the facilities but very close the dubai mall which have lots inside. The gym is brilliant and totally new. I guess all the health club is excellent. You have a variety of restaurants/pubs to dine enjoy in. i would recommend Sakura and Wagmama for who love Japanese/Asian. Steak House is over priced and not a popular place. My Favorites are cafe Barabra and Cappucino cafe. Al Tannour is Lebanese one of the best spots BUT its opened for dinner only, and the menu is fixed so I guess you can enjoy Lebanese food but you will have to be eating a lot. its atmosphere is not Lebanese but its closed to the gulf atmosphere. even the management of the restaurant gives you the feeling they are in a different place separated from the hotel. Al Fresco Italian is my favorite as well and serves excellent food/drinks. AL Dana which is the main restaurant serves international food and is good option as well. You have others like Oscan Vine, Trader Vics, and Zinc to enjoy music/drinks as well. The Main issue with the hotel that it needs renovation/improvement/revamping. I understand that this process is ongoing but its going very slowly and at the same time many new hotels around gives the same service with the same or even better prices. My conclusion that may be the owner don't want to invest money in this process.

Reviews.Title: “Old dated rooms that need major upgrade. Location Good.”
Reviews.Author: sotasan
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here on a business trip on October 17. I had just spent 2 nights in the Crowne Plaza in Abu Dhabi which was excellent, so i had a direct comparison since it's the same Crowne Plaza chain. This one was a major letdown. The only plus is location. Sheikh Zayed is a major artery in Dubai and gets you pretty much anywhere, so the hotel is well situated. Metro is about 5 minutes away, and there're always taxis outside, so accesibility is easy. That's where the pluses ended for me. The service was flippant and off the cuff. It's a really large hotel, and they're dealing with tons of customers, but still the service can be better. I checked in with a colleague who i was travelling with, and our bags were delivered to each others rooms! Complete [---] which we had to resolve ourselves. The rooms however were the greatest disappointment. Realy old, dated and had a musty smell. The airconditioning wasn't cool enough which trust me in Dubai REALLY MATTERS. I was only there for one night, so i didn't complain and just got on with it. I couldn't check out fast enough. There are also prostitutes outside the hotel at night. I didn't care, because i was there on a business, but if you're taking your family with children that might be an issue. This hotel isn't cheap and is definitely not good value for money. I will not return. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Gym at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmjr2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business. I would rate the gym the best out of all the hotel gyms I've been to. I was able to get a good workout every day. Good variety of new machines and free weighs. The change room and sauna were excellent. I try to stay in shape on my business trips and this hotel's facilities were the most convenient and comfortable ever. The hotel's location was great for my business meetings. I enjoyed the local club downstairs and did not have to worry about getting a taxi and going around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, great gym”
Reviews.Author: therealmikeward
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Crowne Plaza for about 5 weeks in May/June 2011, and overall it was a pretty pleasant experience. Location-wise, it's smack on Sheikh Zayed Rd and only 5 mins walk from the Metro - very useful. Taxis are easy to get outside of the hotel too, and there's always staff on hand out of the front to put you in a taxi. The staff were professional and also friendly, but not overly so - this is a big hotel, you won't get any first-name recognition or anything like that! My room (15th floor) was nice and faced towards the back of the hotel (away from Sheikh Zayed Rd, and instead towards the mosque). It was quiet and fairly spacious. The bed was comfortable, and the room had a sofa and decent desk too. The bathroom was very small, but adequate. If you're on a Club level, those rooms have Molton Brown toiletries which are absolutely excellent (best I've ever seen in a hotel) so make sure you stock up :) And the rest of the hotel? Excellent gym, really excellent. I think they had 4 or 5 treadmills, plus cross trainers, a few bikes, a rower, a MASSIVE free weights area and 10 or so resistance machines too. Best gym I've seen in a hotel in a long time - high ceilinged and fairly cool as well. The pool area is alright, faces onto Sheikh Zayed so not the quietest, and when I was there (May) it loses the sun after about 2pm or so as it goes behind the building - but perhaps that's not SUCH a bad thing given Dubai's temperatures! I never really eat breakfast at hotels, but it seemed fine the once or twice I did, nothing special. The steak restaurant was acceptable but very overpriced, wouldn't particularly recommend that. The Japanese restaurant is excellent, they had lovely Tepenyaki chefs and the food was of very high standard. Good saki too. Harvester's Pub was frequented on a fairly regular basis in order to watch various sporting events that were going on during my stay, and it is excellent for that. They have a LOT of TVs (including a big screen) and they can show multiple sports at once. Pub grub is probably slightly above average, big portion sizes for sure. Staff were very friendly too. And then there's the famous nightclub, Zinc, right at the entrance to the hotel. As a hotel guest you get in for free. I would describe this place as... interesting. Mix of clientèle seems to be hotel guests, hotel guests from other hotels, the occasional group of cabin crew (on certain nights) and... prostitutes. There's certainly a fair amount hanging around outside the hotel on Thursday and Friday nights, and it's not that unusual to run into them in the corridors of the hotel either (I did a couple of times in my stay there). It's not something that bothers me at all, and it's certainly not threatening, but if that's something that might upset you if you're wandering the hotel late at night, you might want to consider somewhere else. Oh, I almost forgot Trader Vic's which is the other bar in the hotel - their food is pretty good, and they have an EXCELLENT cocktail menu. It gets pretty busy on weekends, and their live band is good too. Worth checking out. So, in summary, a good hotel in a nice location. If a good hotel gym is important to you, this is a good place to be!

Reviews.Title: “One night lay over.”
Reviews.Author: charlietraveler57
Reviews.Content: Big, busy but great location for getting around. Lastminute.com secret hotel so very cheap, bed room was a bit smelly, i would normally have had them chance my room but could not be bothered on this occasion. Im a member of priority club but think when you book via another agent you get no treats, so whats the point! Room had everything maybe needs the air conditioning updating. Bed not bad, asked for more water and another bathrobe from housekeeping which was speedy and pleasant. Pool area ok for on a main highway, its handy for some decent places to eat and we went to Teatro as we had done some 9 years ago, its still one of the best. Overall we would use this hotel again if i find a deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Is it really five star?”
Reviews.Author: cxahmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of days. I must say that I was a little bit disappointed. The rooms cost quite a lot. They are clean and so but need some uplifting. The most disappointing about this hotel is the breakfast. Except for some dry Liba bread they did not have any other breads to offer. The breakfast was generally also very poor and lacked quality. The most disturbing thing that happened here was that I was asked by the hotel staff to fill in an evaluation review about the hotel during my last day at the breakfast. I filled it in and handed over. Now, these are supposed to be anonymous. But the staff member went five meters away, opened my review, and started reading it. Thats not it, he came back and started to questioning me why I had answered in a curtain way. I got angry, and I told him that if he is not interested in knowing the truth and improving the service through these evaluations, then he should not conduct these evaluations - and then I left later that day. Further, if you are going with family, it is very disturbing that there are so many prostitutes hanging outside the entrance of this hotel. A recommend everyone to look away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good property, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Loyalty-Club
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at this property at least 4 times. I certainly like the location, very handy for the Metro just a few minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are very clean and have all of the required facilities. Looking a bit dated now, however still good for the price. I'm in the top tier member of the priorityclub programme, however I always seem to be put in a room next to the lifts so I hear the regular loud ping sound whenever they are in use and arrive on the floor I'm staying on. I can't understand why supposedly best customers get rooms with this annoyance. Whenever I point this out I get the usual message, the hotel is very full at the moment. A better way of identifying top tier guests and better rewarding them should guarantee this hotel more repeat business, if they need it. Rather than stay my full vacation time in Dubai at this hotel, because of the lack of recognition, I now stay just one or two nights (due to my late flight arrival and this hotel's slightly cheaper rates) and then transfer to the InterContinental at Festival City for the extra recognition and benefits. I also don't know what's happening to the original shopping mail attached to this hotel as it's now all closed off (originally it had loads of shops and other restaurants) and now it gives the area a feel of being a bit of a ghost town. I hope there are plans to re-open it. Also the Steak Restaurant is very over priced in this hotel and frequently empty as a result. Lower your prices please and watch the place fill up. In summary a good hotel, a little dated, but with great potential which I hope they build on.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: PickyglobetrotterUk
Reviews.Content: Not up to Crowne Plaza standards. Where shall I start? Tired and dated. Tiny bathroom with less than a metre between toilet an sink. Dirty iron, then replacement had wrong plug for sockets. Adapter that they then supplied broke. Shoe shine service? Rang down to request and was sent 5 shoe sponges to do it myself. Bare wires sticking out of the wall. Complaints? They don't care and the excuse for the poor room quality was that they were very busy... Oh, and the price of this luxury? Over $400 per night. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Classic.. Luxurious.. Friendly.. Close to GITEX”
Reviews.Author: SamehSabry
Reviews.Content: Dubai is a beautiful city yet very crowded, specially during international festivals/conferences/exhibitions. Part of my job was to exhibit at GITEX and I must admit that Crowne Plaza has been the best choice. The hotel is a walking distance from GITEX and after a long hard day what you could probably need is a good/warm smile, well air-conditioned place, clean and comfort room. Crowne Plaza offers all that and way much more.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but still OK”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4 nights during a business trip. It was my first time in Dubai, I was expecting a modern and vibrant hotel but instead this one is in my opinion old-fashioned and boring. It is right on Dubai's main artery. There is a small uninteresting mall downstairs that looks disused, and a Mac Donald's. It is a 10mn drive from a few lively places though. The room was Ok, nothing fancy, my window overlooked the highway and the glaze was thin so I could hear the cars, but at least I could see a little bit of the Burj Khalifa tower. Breakfast was fine, but the waiting line during the weekend (Friday/Saturday) was way too long. The room service food was excellent especially the curry.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but comfortable. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: lubbus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents in a 2 bedroom apartment suite. The hotel has seen better days and is way behind the newer nicer IHG group hotels in Dubai. A refurbishment is in order as areas of the hotel are showing their age. The service was good and breakfast was nice. The hotel's location is very good. Just a short walk to the train station or a short taxi ride to Dubai Mall and not far from the Gold Souk. I would only stay here again if I had no choice but I don't think that is likely. We requested free internet when booking and were given it.

Reviews.Title: “agoraphobia”
Reviews.Author: uerinke
Reviews.Content: As a person with almost 2m height and 130kg weight I felt quite uncomfortable in a bedroom with 10sqm. The bathroom was very nice and spacious. The room therefore appears larger because of the window front to the bathroom. There is an opportunity to close the window with a lamella curtain but it doesn't really protect from getting seen while you have to spend some very private moments on the toilet. But the biggest problem is the bathroom window to the outside- just normal tinted glas (not blurred) with a white roller blind. This becomes latest in the morning an issue if you got a room facing the east and the rising sun is lighting the bedroom at 5:30am through the bathroom glas wall! There are better Hotels with much bigger rooms for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MissJetSetterUK
Reviews.Content: A very dated hotel and different to the other Crowne Plaza's I have stayed in. There was a distinct lack of service with the exception of the staff in Oscar's Wine Bar who were nothing but attentive. As a female travelling alone on business I felt awkward and it's not an easy hotel to navigate around on your own! In the end I hung out at the Shangri-La down the road, where they went out of their way to make sure you felt secure and happy. For three of the six nights I could not sleep for loud music being played by neighbouring residents and taxis beeping their horns at 3am. I rang reception who suggested this was normal for Dubai. I didn't experience this on my previous two trips but hey ho! I would expect free wifi for an international chain like CP. Even when paid for, it was slow so I gave in!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel - ideal for both tourist as well as business visitors”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Mittal
Reviews.Content: Visited on family vacation to Dubai. We were on our way back from Mauritius and the flight was scheduled to arrive early morning at Dubai. As we reached hotel, we were given an early check in. The room was located on the 10th floor in the tower adjacent to the reception lobby. The room was spacious with 2 queen sized bed very suitable for family of 2 adults and 2 kids. The room had a small kitchenette, mini bar and a small refrigerator. However, the furnishing was quite old and the room had a damp smell which remained there despite of best efforts by the house keeping. The hotel has a shopping area and the restaurants on the first two floors and next two floors are for business centre, hotel restaurants, fitness centre, banquets and swimming pool. The lobby of the hotel wears a business look and it looks as if it is made for business travellers only. I would like to make special mention of Mr.Seddiqui, captain/ Asstt. manager in the Al Dana cafe (breakfast area), who had been very warm and paid special attention to guest request. Internet is free for one hour for hotel guests in the breakfast area. The breakfast was sumptuous and I would rate it high, in comparison to other hotels I had visited in sequence to our vacation. I find that the staff in general was not kid friendly, with any activities of the kids being noticed constantly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Puhup_Verma
Reviews.Content: the first and foremost reason why i chose this hotel was because of its location.sheikh zayed road is at such a central location in dubai that almost everything is at an equal distance from here.the burj khalifa and the dubai mall are nearby,takes just 10 dhs to reach there on a taxi. the rooms are nice,not as good as the other crowne plaza hotels i have stayed in,but good. the staff is very good.they go out of the way to help you,very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, rooms a little small but staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: JOHNPK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend stopover during a long trip.Hotel is on the main road into Dubai and is a good location to see Dubai being close to the Metro and taxis and plentiful and quite reasonable. Rooms are quite small for two people and seemed to be set out for one, with one robe and towels for one etc. We were in a Club room but we looked in a friends room a few floors below and they were exactly the same. Club lounge was very nice with excellent staff. Service with a smile and a cheery chat every day. Being a non smoker I was surprised to find smoking in the pub Harvesters was obligatory! I was the only person not puffing away in there. I lasted enough time to ask staff where I could drink my beer without coughing and was cheerfully told to go outside. It was only 40+ degrees! The pool is on the main road on floor 3. Its a little tatty and serves for a cool down but not for an afternoons rest. The place fills up pretty quick. Eating in the hotel can be a bit pricey but there are enough local eaateries to keep costs down, including a TGIF next door which is pretty reasonable. There aare supermarkets 5 mins away where you can get a coke for a tenth of the price of the hotel price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was more of a business type hotel than a holiday stop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Theyoung1
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The room was fit for a king, the staff were wonderful to deal with: friendly and professional. The breakfast was really good too. The first time in a long time, the wake-up call was a real person-heck that is worth 5 stars alone. The only thing to be careful for is the taxi drivers. It cost us $10 to get to the hotel from the airport; $7.00 from the hotel to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Typical & Professional”
Reviews.Author: GreekAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed about a week in January ,first impression very positive it might helped the Xmas decoration that it was still on.Generally it gives the impression that every single cm is used efficiently.Interesting view from the top floor rooms.You are pretty much close to what Dubai center has to offer. +General quality of services almost up to the standards of the name. +Professional service.Not very friendly though. +Good breakfast (not excellent).Variety needs some improvement.Somewhat boring after a couple of days. +Business center. +Quality of sleeping. -Average (needs serious improvement) room service.Calling at least 2 times to respond. - + Restaurants/Bars inside : Tried the Al Fresco's with below to average results.Plenty of choices for food/drinks though inside the hotel. -You have to order a coffee (or something that costs over some amount of Drhs) in order to have a 1hour "free" Internet Access.Unacceptable in year 2011.Especially in a technological marvel as Dubai. -Magnetic stripe cards (key cards) have extremely the tendency to de-magnetized their shelf with no apparent reason. Summary an average (for it's class) hotel to use it as your base for exploring Dubai ,very good option for conventions and conferences but you might also consider other options when traveling for fun/sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel - if your a light sleeper this hotel is not for you!”
Reviews.Author: fussyboots01
Reviews.Content: Before we even arrived at the crowne plaza dubai I had tried to contact the hotel, as i had booked through lastminiute.com so i wanted confirmation of our booking. I waited a month and no one replied!!! - i actually emailed them twice after and gave up and rang them and complained, we got an upgrade when we arrived to make up for it so we were happy. Although the hotel was nice, clean,2 MAJOR issues: 1) the hotel has a nightclub in the basement - and at approx 3am lots and lots of taxi's line up around the back (car park) to pick people up. - for 3 nights in a row we were woken up by taxi drivers honking their horns constantly and we were on the 16th floor!!!. This goes on for a good 30-40 mins - we did complain and were told that the night manager would deal with it but they didnt. 2)My husband was approached on two occasions by prostitues in the hotel in the evening - we complained about that too after the first time but 2 days later he was approached again!!!. You dont expect this from a "5star" hotel. If I had teenage boys I would have certainly felt uneasy if they walking around the hotel on their own. Whilst the staff seemed very helpful they didnt actually do anything. My advice is unless you get a really really cheap deal dont bother- there are much nicer hotels in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting set up”
Reviews.Author: jasanti7
Reviews.Content: My company must have a deal with this hotel because I stay at this hotel 6 times per year. The location is great...Sheikh Zayed Rd is like Main St. in towns back home. The staff at the Crowne are friendly, but as with everything in Dubai, it will take patients on both ends in order for a smooth transaction to occur. The "club/bar" downstairs attracts ladies looking for dates. Overall, I would rate this hotel a 3.5/4, def not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business and vocation”
Reviews.Author: Elena201113
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crown Plaza Sheikh Zayed in May 2011 for a conference (Arabian Travel Market) and for a vocation after. The hotel is located at central Sheikh Zayed road which is ideal for business visitors (close to Exhibition Center) and leisure travelers (Dubai Mall – 5 min by car) and 2 metro stations (3 min by walk). The hotel is just 10 min drive on free hotel’s shuttle bus and free access to Jumeirah Public Park and Beach. The service and treatment of guests are excellent. Among many restaurants and bars I would recommend Club lounge at 17th floor where you can enjoy food, drinks and business center. You will be called by name and served your favorite drink. Amazing! I would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but need little improved service and security”
Reviews.Author: Atycoon
Reviews.Content: We were a group of around 300 persons. When reached hotel, were glad to see that location was good, not far from airport and also not far from attractions like Burj Khalifa or Dubai Mall. McDonald, Subway, Burgerking, Metro Station etc. are next door. But staff was unable to handle checking of large group and it took over 4 to 5 hours for check-in all persons which was very painful after a long overnight flight from Delhi. BUT in this I will say that more mistake was more on Tour Operators side (Cox & King, India) as on their part, it was total miss-management. But after check-in, every thing was good, rooms are spacious, well equipped. wihtin group, we were 6 family members but we couldnt get rooms on same floor. Breakfast arrangement was for group was done separately and it was well spread with special indian dishes. next day morning of check-in (April 16), we were waiting in Lobby and while going out, in hurry, I forgot my Digital Camcoder (Sony HD) in the lobby. We realised quite late that its missing but were sure that being in Hotel Lobby, it should be safe. But when we checked with hotel staff, they referred to Lost and Found, but got plain answer, they didnt find any camera. As lobby was equipped with close circuit cameras, we requested security there to check the footage, they refused to help in this. We know that we are at mistake by leaving the camera in Lobby but if staff wanted, alteast we could have found that who picked it up (with the help of footage of close circuit camera). Now we are wondering whats the use of it and whether they were actually working or just for show? We have extended our trip for 2 more days (separate from group) When every body of the group left, we were at ease (including hotel staff), we also got all 3 rooms on same floor, breakfast at coffee shop was even much better then for the group... OVERALL experience was good except the bad taste for loosing camera and then non-cooperation from hotel staff about it. AND staff seemed little annoyed with the group handling as when group left and we found great chanage (for better) in the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SimonJ54
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Dubai on holiday with my wife having been many times before on business. On arrival at 2am we were checked in quickly and efficiently by polite and friendly staff at reception. We were upgraded to a club room and found it simply furnished by Dubai standards but clean, quiet and with a very comfortable bed. While the furniture was a little basic by Dubai standards it was entirely in line with European and US 5 star hotels that we've stayed in before and very reasonably priced. The room cleaner couldn't do enough for us when we requested items from extra billows to a bowl of fruit. Like the other hotel staff he really went out of his way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The location was good being very close to the new Dubai metro and a 5 minute taxi ride to the Emirates Mall and Khalifa Tower. The beach is a 15 minute drive. I have already recommended this hotel to many of my friends and colleagues and my wife and I have decided to stay there next year and for longer than the 5 nights on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: valueformoneyplease9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip. The hotel was a 20 minute taxi journey from the airport. Although Taxis in Dubai are very cheap we tended to use the new metro for most our journeys, we payed a little more for a gold card and this was well worth it as it pretty much guaranteed a seat and was air conditioned. I felt the hotel was a little dated and would be 4 star max in most countries let alone Dubai. There were a number of closed shops attached to the hotel, I was not sure if these were just closed down or being redeveloped, The pub was ok apart from the lousy singer, the nightclub was good. There were a number of restaurants at the hotel but we chose to eat away from the hotel as they all seemed a little quiet. We used the wireless internet in the lobby coffee lounge as they provided a free internet access code on request. One of my major problems with hotels in this day and age is when they charge for Internet use and to charge nearly £20 for one days wifi in a room is a disgrace especially when it is not that fast, I felt a little robbed. My room was a decent size as being an ambassador member I recieved an upgrade. Overall the hotel was ok but next time I visit Dubai I will more than likely book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ganesh369
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel from November 11th to November 14th,2010 to attend a business conference which had almost 100 people. I was quite impressed with the size of their conference which was humongous to say Their banquet staff were friendly, courteous and quite prompt whenever i had asked for something. Their buffet breakfast and lunch was quite good with a good selection of vegetarian and non vegetarian items. All in all their conference facilities were what you would expect in a 5 star Hotel. The rooms were tastefully done albeit a little small. The beds were comfortable and super soft and I had slept like a log all the three nights I was there. The only grouse I had was with room service. They could do way better on that front considering the time taken to service an order. This was during Eid and I was told the Hotel was booked to full capacity and hence the delay in their room service Finally the location is spot on. There’s a host of eating joints on Sheikh Zayed Road and one only needs to take a walk down the hotel to enjoy these. It’s also well connected with taxis stopping right outside the Hotel. The metro is just 10 mins walk from the Hotel which is an added bonus and takes you to any part of Dubai. Oh and there’s also a nightclub in the Hotel called Zinc, nothing exceptional like the other fancy discotheques in Dubai but not too bad either. The Hotel’s in house eating joints I heard are top notch. In short, I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking to enjoy a 5 star experience in Dubai at a reasonable price with an unbeatable location to match. Go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Theperry
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my girlfriend. Arrived late and went in to the nightclub located at the hotel. Been in Dubai a few times but first time at this hotel chosen by its location. We where in Dubai for shopping so the location is just great. We also got the free ride to the public beach. After complaining about noice we had a new room. The staff was very friendly and serviceminded. Wagamama located in the hotel was very good. Nice but a bit slow service by the pool deck not to pricy. Pool deck was ok. So overall I can recomend this hotel would give it four stars great price great location and all service you need in a hotel and also close to Dubai mall burj Kalifa and the metro is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “very good room location dood dubai view”
Reviews.Author: pravin236
Reviews.Content: nice location near to metro very nice clubs and good music,nearness to eating joints and nice lobby i used minibar good one and reception area service is very fast mattress is good so you dont miss good night sleep room is quite big with good tv

Reviews.Title: “Great location/hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColetteBeynon
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly hotel. Loads of choice re:restaurants which makes transport a non issue. Venue superb as close to metro, old and new Dubai! Staff absolutely great. Loved every minute of our stay there....will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Rather old and not up to general Dubai hotelstandards”
Reviews.Author: Helsinkiglobus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Dubai International airport with approx. 20 minutes by taxi. It’s situated by the Sheikh Zayed road that runs through Dubai. The blue metro line also runs along the same road and a metro station is approx.10 minute walk from hotel. Location is also good for the Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa towers with approx 10 minutes ride by taxi. Otherwise hotel is situated rather far from the beach and the 5 star hotels and districts for best nightlife and restaurants. It will take you approx. 20 minutes (30 – 40 dirham by taxi) to the Jumeirah Beach Park for the beach and other areas for enjoying evenings. The hotel building itself is rather old and has seen better days. It’s connected to a small shopping mall which was closed or under renovation. The lobby is rather plain but works for its purpose. It doesn’t feel very enticing and inviting for having a drink etc. Check-in was crowded but manageable on arrival. Got upgraded to a “Captain’s Suite” which was adequate but wouldn’t have noticed being in a “suite” without the sign on the wall. Nothing special but the room was comfortable and adequate with basic amenities. Air conditioning system was fairly loud but fortunately didn’t need to have it on in the evenings. Internet was expensive (25 USD / 24hrs) and slow. The swimming pool is small and located on the 3rd floor towards the high way so you hear and see the cars and traffic. The sun hits the pool area up to approx. 3 pm in the afternoon. It’s a bit crowded and not the sort of place you would want to spend a day soaking in the sun. Went to the gym which was being renovated. There wasn’t much space but the gym equipment was new. Breakfast service was quite disappointing as the breakfast area is way too small for the number of guests in the hotel. The tables were full at breakfast rush hour (8 – 9 am) with lots of hassle and queuing. The employees do their best but the area should be enlarged and upgraded. Breakfast assortment was ok but nothing special. Taking into consideration the general level of hotels in Dubai I would look for another newer establishment. On Dubai scale this gets 2,5 stars out of 5. There’s nothing terribly wrong with this but there’s no splendor to it and the worn out building needs a substantial facelift. Nevertheless, the staff was friendly and did their best.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlw37
Reviews.Content: great location half way between old Dubai and new town, large hotel fantastic rooms and impeccable service. Breakfast is out of this world with so much choice and caters for all nationalities. Very clean and tidy although not most modern looking but dont let this out you off because you wont be dissapointed. Lovely warm swimming pool, great poolside service and nothing to mcuh trouble from hotel staff. Cant recommend this hotel enough and a must is to visit Oscars wine cellar as its a lost gem and one of the nicest bars we found in the city! sure you'll enjoy it as much as we did

Reviews.Title: “strange place..”
Reviews.Author: sayed_alk
Reviews.Content: stayed at the crowne plaza dubai for couple of night Check in was very fast and i have been upgrated which i appreciated Room was a bit old, old furnitures but view was very good internet very slow, but they give free internet near to recpetion if you order a drink. There is one arabic restaurant in the hotel, food was not really good and fresh, also lot of prositutes in this restaurant, which seems to be acknowledged and encouraged by the manager of this outlet (!!??) this was a strange experience to stay in this hotel and i was bit shocked by what i saw in the arabic restaurant, but it was interesting to come there.. maybe you just need to avoid some specific places

Reviews.Title: “Great and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Changmaisausage
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the CP from Dubai airport after a twenty five minute drive. At check-in we received a room upgrade to an apartment that was well received. Room was clean and of a good size (16th floor) though looks a little aged. The location of the hotel was great, the rail station was only a five minute walk away and very inexpensive. Taxi's are available directly outside the hotel. We only ate once in the hotel bar the food was okay nothing special. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you will get the services what you have paid for”
Reviews.Author: Qwelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 2 nights on 4th and 5th Feb11. When I enquired about my booking at the Check in Counter, the lady at the reception simply looked at his colleague without acknowledging my query, forget a smile. I thoiught she would demand some money for this kind gesture! Anyway, her colleague did the check in less than 2 minutes and I was shown a room in their Club floor. This hotel is at least 15 years old and in the club room, you have to jump in to the bath tub to get a shower! At 5 pm, there was no hot water coming in the tub/shower booth. We attended a conference in this hotel and we were served a conf meal which was at its superlative quality, providing recycled food meant only for these money paying conference people. The room size was normal compared to Dubai hotels and big considering Indian and European hotels. For the conference guests, the breakfast was served at an independent location. When I asked for an omlette, the waiter was just showing me a tray of scrambles eggs. So, no hot breakfast was served. In the morning, when I opned the door to get a newspaper ( club room freebies!), there was none. I called the guest relations executive and she told me she would send it immediately. After 15 minutes, the same lady told me to talk to Concierge for the newspaper. I did not call the Concierge fearing that he would aks me to talk to the cashier! Good service! Then that day went off with out any major event. Next day, we checked out after eating the same cold brekfast. Maybe, we will get the services what we are paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albela_Musafir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Sheikh Zayed Business Area and is a good choice if you have to do business around it. The hotel was built in 80's and hence has an old look. The Hotel is a 5 star rated, so comes with all amenities. My Room was good, decent size. I also had a small kitchen in the room. The staff informed me that room was renovated 2 years back. You could see the renovation, but still overall it gives an old feeling. The staff was nice, no complaints about it. The Hotel has a decent pricing, and often runs promotion on dinner. But Still, I would suggest to try another posh shiny hotel nearby, if you plan to stay in Dubai for 2-3 day.. Why not stay in the best ??

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Tired, TIRED!”
Reviews.Author: PhantomTraveler79
Reviews.Content: Man, this place is more tired than a fat man after a 5K. What can you say? This was the first 5 star hotel built in Dubai....So that means there approximately 59 newer ones in operation. The Crowne Plaza has a good location for business travelers, across from DIFC and Emirates Towers. It's also great because you have a Metro stop a couple hundred feet away and you are in the middle of the city. But if you are not here to do business and you have a choice as to where you stay, don;t stay here. There is no compelling reason to. They are remodeling the gym, pool and commercial space on the ground floor, so who know what will happen, but for now, stay at the Fairmont or somewhere else in the area for some of that Dubai sparkle....The sparkle here faded looooong ago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, good locstion”
Reviews.Author: BSFTL
Reviews.Content: Just arrived at this Dubai hotel very early, we were granted an Upgrade to a spacious studio room and got a very early check in. Breakfast was also very nice with plenty of food to choose from. Hotel is 15 minutes away from the airport (40 Dirhams = approx 8 Euros taxi fare). Dubai Mall is just 10 minutes away. Beautiful pool, good fitness room. However, the hotel is not top modern, you miss nothing. Worth a stay definetly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: salgitay
Reviews.Content: We chose CP for our stay in Dubai. When checked in we had certain issues with the network and telephone. But the management was really helpful and actioned to our request immediately. The hotel has very generous and helpful staff around. I would really like to extend my thanks to Mr. Sharma ( at the concerige) who guided us with the place to be seen and also Mr.Mani (I hope the name is correct) the gentleman who efficiently managed the guest with the seating arrangements during breakfast time. We loved our stay at the hotel and wish to return for our next trip with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: aayushrivastava
Reviews.Content: Not as costly but still as trendy as the best in Dubai, this Crowne Plaza property is specially designed for business travellers. Rooms are good, breakfast is amazing and the location is amazing. I am definitely going to stay here again, the next time I visit Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “More than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanno4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights in November 2010. All your needs are met (and something more )in this hotel. I could not fault it at all. What a fulfilling experience! . I stayed with my wife and 3 children for a 10 days leisure trip. Location is great , in the heart of Dubai along the main road with everything nearby. Taxis are always on the door , they are really cheap. There is a nearby metro station and a bus station both are reached by a 2 minutes walk. Staff were all polite , efficient and very well experienced. Anything you ask or need ,they provide it instantly with a smile. Reception , lobby , restaurants , housekeeping , pool area...etc. All staff there were really nice , dependable and try to help you all the times. Check In took 2 minutes and check out 1 minute! The hotel is clean luxuriuous and well maintained.The room (I stayed in a 2 bedrooms suite) is spacious, clean and well furnished . The beds are really comfortable : mattress , sheets and pillows are of fine qualities.. I slept very well all the nights. All TVs (I had 3) were 32, 40 inches LCD with more than 70 channels to satisfy all your needs. There is big sofa area and dining area. The room has all the facilities you need . It is well maintained , clean with good lightening.I had a full kitchen with Large ref., microwave, washing machine , dryer , oven ...etc. there is a comfortable sitting area and dining area. Heavy double window glass so that you can not hear any voice outside . The breakfast is fantastic .Every thing you can imagine is present in this buffet breakfast. The hotel is a heaven for food lovers . They have 12 restaurants that satisfy all the tastes. AlDana is an international restaurant that has a special cuisine every night . Harvesters pub is a must try one with English food and atmosphere . Alfresco is a great Italian restaurant. Altannour has fantastic oriental lebanese food.There is also Wagamama, Thai and Japanese restauraunts . Finally there is Western steakhouse and Oscar`s vine society. The pool area is great .It is opened from 7 am till 10 pm and the pool man is always there for help ,with nice refreshment area that serves fresh juice , salad , sandwiches ..It is big enough and open over a great view to emirate towers and sheikh Zayed road. There is a well equipped fitness centre . The hotel has a hot night life with zinc night club in the ground floor that attracts a large number of lovely men and women from all over Dubai.It is big , vibrant with a crazy atmosphere .They offered free dinks for ladies in some nights. . I went there 4 nights during my stay. Altannor offers an arabian night with singers and belly dancing . It also offers excellent lebanese food with shisha smoking. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to Dubai mall , emirates mall , Jumeirah beach park and to airport. What remains to tell is there is a mall in the ground floor with many shops , cafes , McDonalds , pharmacy , beauty saloon and a supermarket . Do you need anything more ? I am waiting for my next visit to crowne plaza , Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Try it out once”
Reviews.Author: whizkid420
Reviews.Content: We had gone to dubai for a conference and were booked in the Crowne plaza. This hotel is the heart of the city with other modern hotels in the neighborhood. At about 20-25 minutes drive from the airport, it's very close by. One can have a view of the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world, from the hotel. The rooms were very spacious with all the facilities available. The room service that we experienced was not good. Wake up calls were missed, other requests were not met at all. Looking at the reputation, this has to be improved a lot. the staff could also be a bit more courteous to their customers. Food quality was good. If one does not want to have hotel food, then there's McDonald's and other restaurants with in the hotel complex. There's also a shopping mall over here. Would recommend to stay here for the rooms & the location.

Reviews.Title: “CP Dubai - Award winner for slowest check out Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walloush
Reviews.Content: I have stated at CP in Dubai over 10 days in the past 3 years. check in & check out usually goes smoothly; However this time it was a very different experience. Check out took around 45 minutes for no reason. The receptionist ( Lawrence ) is definitely an award winner of the slowest receptionist ever. He kept staring at his screen, wouldn’t smile, we would call him & he wouldn’t even answer. I have even asked him if there is an issue which is making the check out very difficult for him but he said no its all fine. We have almost missed our flight because of this gentleman. If you go to CP Dubai Please avoid Mr. Lawrence or you would miss your flight !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,Good Food, 5am wake up call mosque across rd,room walls thin”
Reviews.Author: aggie49
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel restaurants very nice prices about what we expected breakfast very expensive but good.centrally located good metro system spotlessley clean. many places to eat would visit again maybe try different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel every time”
Reviews.Author: AnnMacD
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three or four times in the past seven years and it doesn't disappoint. It's one of the older Dubai hotels (if any can really be considered old in a city so young) but the rooms are very very spacious and have everything one would need. They are aware of any shortcomings (for instance, the old style hairdryers are a bit weak on the airpower, so they indicate that if you want a stronger model, they'll deliver it to your room-- the old version is still attached to the wall). The only drawback is that there is no free internet, although you can sometimes get it in the business center depending on which attendant is on duty (some will ask you to pay and some will not bother to ask-- rather inconsistent). The other bonus is the view from the pool-- it is outside on the third floor and has a view of some of the most attractive skyscrapers (including the world's tallest, Khalifa Tower) at close range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - And they serve pork!”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay overall. Upgraded on arrival, without asking for it. Excellent room with a very comfortable bed. The TV channels are a bit limited. Ate in the Harvester Pub and in the Japanese restaurant. Harvester is excellent value; the Sakura somewhat less so. Excellent breakfast. Check in and checkout were very smooth and efficient. Negatives are how busy the lobby gets with people who don't seem to have any reason to be there and the complete chaos at the front entrance; especially when the local posers are allowed to leave their cars in teh tiny driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and very warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bertdewilde
Reviews.Content: Staff : Excellent Location : Excellent Rooms : Clean, Warm, Not too big, not too small Book the Club Room : internet access, breakfast & drinks all day long...

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Crowne Plaza on SZR”
Reviews.Author: jim_julian
Reviews.Content: An impressive property, well located near the Dubai World Trade Center. Twelve great restaurants, no need to dine anywhere else. As a Priority Club Platinum, I got a nice room upgrade. The staff throughout the hotel could not be better, particularly those in the spacious Executive Floor Lounge. The rooms are well set up for business, however, sometimes the Internet is a bit slow, but then this is a common UAE problem during peak usage hours. Nice pool, exercise facility being renovated but the temporary location is fine, in-hotel car rental agency, valet parking ... this hotel is the complete package for business or leisure ... highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family and on business trip”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlusttrokker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza Dubai, Sheikh Zayed road since 2005 as a business traveller and on family vacation. Everything from location, rooms, service is fantastic at the CPD. The GRO are gracious, their rooms are excellent, the FO and HK staff are amazing. I love their trader's vic, it's one of the places that I have to frequent whilst in Dubai and the disco that they have downstairs. Have tried the wagamama once and it was pretty neat. There is a McDonald and Friday's in the same complex which was perfect for my kids. The location is amazing.. bang in the middle of everywhere. Their fitness center is not much to talk about though..

Reviews.Title: “Very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamburg_girl_1982
Reviews.Content: We've stayed 3 nights in the Crowne Plaza and we were completely happy with it. Because the hotel wasn't too busy they've upgraded us to a premium room on the 21st floor. The view from there was amazing. The staff was always really nice and helpful. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel is in a really good location to all the attractions either by a walk or short and handy metro or taxi ride or you take the free shuttle to some malls and to the airport. We're definetly recommending this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: Baggerz
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for business travellers. Close to the airport and central for business district. It is not really a romantic lesuire break hotel, there are plenty of others in Dubai if that is what you want. Rooms are good and are clean and comfortable. You are in Dubai and on Sheik Zayed road so do expect traffic noise, if you want solitude and quiet you are in the wrong city ! Value wise, I paid around 700 Dhms a night and compared to colleagues who stayed in Al-Murooj Rotana (1400 Dhms), a 10 minute cab ride away, I felt it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: BeachLovingBanker
Reviews.Content: The location is within walking distance to the Metro Station. There is no free parking around the hotel, except at weekends. The hotel is set within a shopping mall with a variety of restaurants nearby. There is a nightclub and a Wagamama's at the hotel. The rooms were basic with comfortable beds. The only negative point was breakfast. During our stay, there was a wedding party all staying at the hotel and breakfast was always crowded as the guests were loud, hungry and impatient to the point that the hotel staff had to limit the portion of food on the buffet spread. Ordering eggs took more than 15mins as they purposely slowed the process to restrict the food available. This was definitely the worst hotel buffet ever. For a city like Dubai where food is normally plentiful, it was quite disgraceful that the hotel had to ration the breakfast. Checking in and out of the hotel took ages as well even as a Priority Club member. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Value only for business trip”
Reviews.Author: saviodcruise
Reviews.Content: Do If going to dxb on a business visit, this hotel is recommended. Dont If travelling on leisure this hotel is not recommended. Hotel full all through the day and noisy. All restaurants are full as well all the time. Rooms are quite small. Room Service pretty bad had to call several times to get the line, no one at reception picks up if they busy. Service of receptionists pretty bad with lack of experience. Pricing of rooms needs to be more reasonable for the amount paid. Pricing in Mini bar is way too expensive and ridiculous. Nothing Complimentary after paying such a huge room bill. No beach fun, everything is quite far from this hotel and also gettin to the hotel is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Hotel 5 stars excellent”
Reviews.Author: dubai72
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our honymoon. We had excellent time. Spend 5 days at the Dubai Crown Plaza hotel. It was perfect. Clean, nice and friendly hotel- staff, We had our room cleaned every day. I wish we could stay there for a long time. :) I am deffinatelly recommending this hotel to all of you... Food was cheap as well. Hyper supermarket was close by so we done our shopping in there. :) free transport to lots of places. Private beach - free transport. Shopping mall - free transport. Use of metro - very easy ... enjoy your stay .. wish I was in Dubai right now.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: Atef220
Reviews.Content: i just came yesterday from Dubai and i stayed in Crown Plaza - Dubai, its really amazing hotel, lot of restaurants inside, zinc night club, small shopping mall down with super market. the people there are very friendly and very helpful in everything. i made the reservation through priority club membership website and it was AMAZING price (about 90 USD only / night) and because of my platinum membership they upgrade my standard room to one bed room studio suit. the hotel very near to metro station which can take you to any where with only very few dirhams. finally i liked the hotel very much and i hope to go there soon again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: lucy555_10
Reviews.Content: Firstly you will love Dubai, the city is spectacular, beautifully Arabian and yet incredibly accomodating to tourists. It is not overpriced and the people are wonderful. It has everything you could want from a holiday. We stayed in the Crowne plaza, great location to all the attractions either by a walk or short and handy train or taxi ride. The services are all you could want with a great concierge service, the rooms are luxurious and the price is just right. Highly recommend the desert safari/desert camp

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: meeravelury
Reviews.Content: Was so close to every major attraction in dubai and the breakfast was really nice! I was staying on the 19th floor so the view was spectacular :) I loved the pub & the italian restaurant in the hotel too.. i would definetly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “zinc the most happening night club is @ crown plaza”
Reviews.Author: rajeshtrips
Reviews.Content: close to the airport and city ! ZINC rocks but starts rocking @ 1:30 and rocks till 3:00. Serves pork ( was kinds surprised being a muslim country ) , nice rooms good restaurents all in all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business travel”
Reviews.Author: 360degreesBangalore
Reviews.Content: Excellent service.. State-of-the-art facillities.. Close proximity to the tourist attractions is an added benefit..

Reviews.Title: ““NIce Hotel in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Harb07
Reviews.Content: It is friendly hotel, food is great in the Italian resturant

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel which is in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Karthic
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is Old . The rooms were quite spacious . Nice restaurant called "Wagamama" in the ground floor . We had some good breakfast at Al Dana . Some staff were not corteous at the Al Dana restaurant . The manager was really energetic and active at Al Dana and was doing his best . im sorry that i forgot his name . They need to atleast give an complimentary internet . Internet was qouted at 125 - 150 Aed / day .

Reviews.Title: “Its Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mmonkie
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza is one of the 2 hotels I stayed at in my recent Dubai trip. It is an older hotel surrounded by shiny new towers. The rooms itself was what you would expect from an older styled hotel in terms of decor and size. The service was ok, not great but acceptable. My main issue was the overwhelming smell of cheap perfume in the lobby, they really should change or use less air refresherners/ Location was good, allowing you to go walk about outside looking at some shoppes and restaurants. The thing I liked about my room was that it gave an excellent view of the sunset. The postcard view of the red sun low on the horizon. I stayed in 2 hotels for this trip and personally in terms of hotels, I prefered the cheaper other option. But the crown wins on location

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: habtheory
Reviews.Content: We booked this quickly and didn’t have a lot of time to research it. On arrival I thought this hotel looked a bit second rate and thought we’d made a mistake. I was wrong. We got in around nine am and were asked if we’d like to upgrade to Club. This is usually a good idea so we agreed. We got to go straight to the room even though it was so early and the room, or should I say suite, was enormous. Lounge and dining area with separate king size bed room and even a powder room in addition to the main bathroom with jacuzi. We slept for 11 hours solid on the first night – the bed was so comfortable and only had a light doona which is what we prefer. The hotel looks like it is due for a makeover as it is a bit dated in its decor but it had so much going for it. We decided to have lunch there on day 1 and went to the buffet. We were told that for May on Saturdays they had a promotion and each person dining got to flip a coin and if a winner, got their meal for free. As I won the flip we got two meals for the price of one and the food was delicious. We thought it was sad that not many people were dining in the restaurants at all and a lot of staff were standing around with not much to do. Eat there if you can – it’s great value and fresh & delicious. Room service servings were huge – enough for four people though there were only two of us. We had a kitchenette in the suite so kept food in the fridge for a late night snack on our second night. We had a 6pm pickup for our onward flight and were permitted to stay in the club lounge for as long as we needed to. The girls there fussed over us and were fantastic. Oh and the gym is huge - best I've ever seen in a hotel. Negatives were the hotel in general was a bit shabby and tired.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: akublues
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip staying with IHG; first in HI Sharjah, second in IH Festival City and this was the third one. Check in was no problem at all, even though we have to wait a while before we can get our room ready. Having problem when went to breakfast even I have book the room one day ahead. Looks like they don't prepare the room for us until we reached the hotel. Being a Malaysian, of course we look similar with the people for South East Asian countries and the staff at the Restaurant greeted me as they thought I'm one of them. When I'm replied in English, they started avoiding me throughout and this was really annoying. Requested for a iced water for 2 days and I've been told that by these people that they do have chilled water at the buffet line. Is it too much for me to ask for that? Anyway, didn't ask for 3rd day and surprisingly, they didn't offer me any drink at all! This was totally unacceptable for me. Only on my last day, this Indian staff attended to my request without any questions and really polite. On room wise, ok for Crowne Plaza standard but on my last night (15th) and we were not informed about the water shutdown. We chose this location because our event was in Dubai Convention Centre. The plus point of this hotel was that they provide free airport shuttle and many complimentary shuttle to outlet mall, MOE.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE, GOOD LOCATED CITY HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: vagvl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my with and it was a pleasent stay.Since it was my frst time in dubai i didn't stay much in the room.The hotel is big with lot of restaurant and a popular club in the lobby as well as lot of stores but i didn't go to any of them.Room is really big with all the necessery comforts and the staff was always helpful and polite, like everybody in dubai. Located in the most central dubai road near Dubai mall, and there's a metro station 5 minutes from the hotel but it's not open yet, looks complete so it should operate soon, there's oerating 15 minutes away. If you looking for a resort hotel it;s not for you,try something near the beach but it should cost you a lot more. If you are in the city for buiseness or sight seeing it's a great hotel. Also like to notice despite the central location the room was the quitest i've ever stayed propably of it's good insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, central location, but never a 5 Star Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JB35
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband for his 50th Birthday. There is no way this should be rated as a 5 Star hotel. The rooms are really old fashioned and shabby. nothing plush about them at all. We had a fridge in the room and the seal on the inside of the door was hanging off and the back of it was a total block of ice. The view from the window was just the carpark.
